org.ingrahamrobotics.dotnettables

Class DotNetTables

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.ingrahamrobotics.dotnettables.DotNetTables

  • public class DotNetTables
extends java.lang.Object
    A wrapper for FRC NetworkTables that provides enforced directionality, a unified view of subscribed and published tables, and periodic updates and staleness detection This project also exposes all of the underlying NetworkTables classes, methods, and data types, for easy inclusion in both Java and .NET projects

    • Field Summary

      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      static java.lang.String TABLE_NAME
      The table name used for the underlying NetworkTable

    • Method Detail

      • startServer

        public static void startServer()
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize a NetworkTables server. In standard FRC usage this is done on the robot. A server can both publish and subscribe to tables; server vs. client mode only controls whether the process listens for inbound network connections.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the underlying network bind() operations fail

      • startClient

        public static void startClient(java.lang.String IP)
                        throws java.io.IOException
        Initialize a NetworkTables client. In standard FRC usage this is done on the driver's station or other remote computers. A client and both publish and subscribe to tables; server vs. client mode only controls whether the process listens for inbound network connections.
        Parameters:
        IP - The IP address of the NetworkTables server. If using standard FRC IP addresses, you may provide your team number instead of the IP address.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException - Thrown if the underlying network bind() operations fail

      • isClient

        public static boolean isClient()
        Returns:
        True if this device is configured as a NetworkTables client, false if configured as a server

      • isConnected

        public static boolean isConnected()
        Returns:
        True if the NetworkTables connection has been successfully initialized

      • subscribe

        public static DotNetTable subscribe(java.lang.String name)
        Subscribe to a table published by a remote host. Works in both server and client modes.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the table to subscribe
        Returns:
        The subscribed table

      • publish

        public static DotNetTable publish(java.lang.String name)
        Publish a table for remote hosts. Works in both server or client modes.
        Parameters:
        name - Name of the table to publish
        Returns:
        The published table

      • drop

        public static void drop(java.lang.String name)
        Removes a table from the subscription/publish list
        Parameters:
        name - The table to remove

      • push

        protected static void push(java.lang.String name,
        java.lang.Object data)
        Push the provided object into the NetworkTable
        Parameters:
        name - DotNetTable name
        data - StringArray-packed DotNetTable data
